org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.Cell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable, CategCell
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmountCell, CategAmountCell, CategAmountCellProto, DateCell, DoubleCell, IntCell, PercentageTextCell, TextCell

    public abstract class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable, CategCell
    an immutable piece of data used for the disaggregated phases of the report. Being the abstract root the classes' hierarchy output by NiReportedEntity.fetch(NiReportsEngine), this is the basic granularity with which data is fed into NiReports. In this capacity, this class defines a number of important contracts which must be obeyed by all the subclasses. The overarching one is that all the subclasses must be deeply immutable, as a given Cell instance might (and will) be shared between:
    • multiple measures
    • different places, for the same measure, in the same report
    • multiple threads operating on same instance or partial clones
    • multiple threads running separate reports concurrently
    • separate reports being run serially
    When subclassing, make sure you override #buildCopy()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      long activityId
      the "owner" id.
      java.util.Map<NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage,NiDimension.Coordinate> coordinates
      the coordinates of this cell in the space of the generating schema.
      long entityId
      the id of the owning entity, where "entity" is the NiDimension.LevelColumn specified by mainLevel (if one exists)
      java.util.Optional<NiDimension.LevelColumn> mainLevel
      defines the NiDimension.LevelColumn which will, together with entityId, define the driving coordinates when doing a hierarchy having this cell instance as a pivot

    • Field Detail

      • activityId

        public final long activityId
        the "owner" id. "activity" s the basic entity of the schema. Named like this because of a lack of a better idea.

      • entityId

        public final long entityId
        the id of the owning entity, where "entity" is the NiDimension.LevelColumn specified by mainLevel (if one exists)

      • coordinates

        public final java.util.Map<NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage,NiDimension.Coordinate> coordinates
        the coordinates of this cell in the space of the generating schema. Can never be null, but might very well be empty.
        In case mainLevel is not empty(), this map should contain an entry having mainLevel.get().dimensionUsage as a key.

      • mainLevel

        public final java.util.Optional<NiDimension.LevelColumn> mainLevel
        defines the NiDimension.LevelColumn which will, together with entityId, define the driving coordinates when doing a hierarchy having this cell instance as a pivot
